featured.text: Abraham Lincoln did the same, but then the inaugural crowds became far too large for the White House to accommodate comfortably, and this also created a security issue.
Thomas Jefferson held the first inaugural open house in 1805; many of those who attended the swearing-in ceremony at the U.S. Capitol simply followed him home.
What does “this practice” refer to in the second paragraph? (A) Holding an inaugural open house.

definition.en_def: Relating to the first occurrence of an event or the beginning of a series.
definition.example: The president delivered his inaugural speech at the ceremony.
